intro: Acetosella eremobia, commonly known as the mountain sorrel, is a low-growing perennial plant belonging to the Geraniaceae family. It is characterized by its rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves and produces small, pinkish-white flowers in early spring. The plant is adapted to rocky and acidic soils, often found in alpine and subalpine regions. It has a shallow root system and is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value. Acetosella eremobia is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
